page.title: 16TOURISM IN BURNHAM MARKET
page.content: As with other parts of Norfolk, many people choose to have {holiday {homes}in Burnham Market. There are twelve holiday homes in the survey area, and these are occupied during the summer months only. Other tourists stay in the The Poplars{caravan park}. This occupies three acres and has 100 permanent caravans, all with mains services (electricity, water and sewage). All the caravans are privately owned and the site is only open during the summer months. There is space for touring caravans. Close to the caravan park is a redundant railway engine shed which houses a collection of{fairground {organs}and{traction engines}. These are taken to local fetes and carnivals where they are popular attractions.
